alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:40AM CDT until further notice by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Shallow flooding of lowlands occurs along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 8.9 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
